intro: Ornithogalum karasbergense, commonly known as Karasberg star-of-Bethlehem, is a perennial herb native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its upright stems and clusters of white, star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it produces small, fleshy berries that contain the seeds. This species is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
